title: Priests, Prophets, and Prohibitions
shortSummary: Deuteronomy 18 outlines the special role and provisions for the Levites and priests, forbids occult practices, and foretells the coming of a prophet like Moses. It emphasizes God’s exclusive authority in revelation and warns against false prophets, establishing a foundation for discerning true divine guidance.
timeline: c. 1406 BC - Israel's wilderness period before entering the Promised Land

keyCharacters.name: Moses
keyCharacters.description: The leader and prophet of Israel who mediates God's law and promises the coming of a prophet like himself.

keyCharacters.name: Levites
keyCharacters.description: The tribe set apart to serve as priests and ministers in Israel, receiving no land inheritance but supported by offerings.

definitions.definition: Members of the tribe of Levi, chosen to serve in religious duties and the priesthood without receiving land inheritance.
The practice of seeking knowledge or guidance through supernatural means forbidden by God.
One who attempts to communicate with the dead, a practice condemned as an abomination.
A messenger raised by God to speak His words and guide His people, often foretelling future events.

outline.heading: Provision for the Levites and Priests
outline.description: God establishes that the Levites will not receive land but will be supported by the offerings and firstfruits of Israel, emphasizing their unique role in ministering before the Lord.

outline.heading: Prohibition of Occult Practices
outline.description: Israel is commanded to reject pagan practices such as divination, witchcraft, and necromancy, which are detestable to God and cause the nations to be driven out.

outline.heading: Promise of a Prophet Like Moses
outline.description: God promises to raise up a prophet from Israel like Moses, who will speak His words and whom the people must obey, pointing forward to Christ and true prophetic authority.

outline.heading: Warning Against False Prophets
outline.description: Instructions are given to discern true prophets by the fulfillment of their words, with severe consequences for those who falsely claim God’s message.

application: Trust and support those who serve God’s work faithfully, recognizing their God-ordained role in the church.
Avoid all forms of occult and divination practices, seeking guidance only through God’s Word and Spirit.
Discern spiritual teaching carefully, testing all prophecy against Scripture and the fruit it produces.
Look to Jesus as the ultimate Prophet like Moses, who perfectly reveals God’s will and commands our obedience.

keyVerses.text: The LORD thy God will raise up unto thee a Prophet from the midst of thee, of thy brethren, like unto me; unto him ye shall hearken;
keyVerses.significance: This verse foretells the coming of Christ, the ultimate prophet who reveals God’s truth perfectly.

keyVerses.text: When a prophet speaketh in the name of the LORD, if the thing follow not, nor come to pass, that is the thing which the LORD hath not spoken, but the prophet hath spoken it presumptuously: thou shalt not be afraid of him.
keyVerses.significance: It provides a clear test for discerning true prophets from false ones, protecting God’s people from deception.

keyVerses.text: Thou shalt be perfect with the LORD thy God.
keyVerses.significance: A call to wholehearted obedience and moral purity before God, foundational for covenant faithfulness.
